docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
GVL Fix One is a high-accuracy RTK GNSS receiver for handheld or static installations.

  • Centimetre-level CEP real time, millimetre-level with postpocessing.

  • Dual-role Basestation and Rover

  • NTRIP transmit and receive

  • MQTT real time telemetry

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text: Click Me

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text: Click me

docs.title: Firmware Update
docs.text: Click me

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
Note

  • Under construction, more details to come!

GVL Fix One reads from configuration files at startup to determine what to do.

docs.title: Accessing Storage
docs.text:
• Plug the the device into a computer

  • Hold power button to switch on

  • On the boot screen, press any key.

  • A USB drive should show up on the computer

docs.title: Files
docs.text:
All files are stored at the root of the SD card.

  • Configuration File: gvl_config.txt

  • MQTT over TLS: Put the server CA certificate as mqtt.crt

    • Not needed for unencrypted MQTT

docs.title: Configuration Options
docs.text:
• Open gvl_config.txt with a text editor

Inside, there are multiple lines of option=value pairs.

Here's an example, details below.

nickname=gvl_test

wifi_ssid=myWifi
wifi_pass=hunter2

// 0: Rover, 1: Basestation
device_role=0

// 0: Wi-Fi, 1: Cellular, others: No Comm.
comm_type=0

// needed for some virtual mountpoints
send_gga=1
use_mqtt=1
log_sd=0

ntrip_addr=ntrip.data.gnss.ga.gov.au
ntrip_port=2101
ntrip_cred=username:password
ntrip_mountpoint=AUTO

mqtt_addr=test.mosquitto.org
mqtt_port=1883
mqtt_username=username
mqtt_password=password

  • Make sure there are no space before or after =

  • Omitted options are 0 (or empty string) by default

docs.title: device_role
docs.text:
Type Example Integer device_role=1

  • 0: Rover mode

  • 1: Basestation mode

docs.title: nickname
docs.text:
Type Example String nickname=gvl_test

  • Device nickname for easy identification

  • Included in MQTT message and logged files

docs.title: comm_type
docs.text:
Type Example Integer comm_type=1

  • 0: Use Wi-Fi for network connection

  • 1: Use Cellular for network connection

  • Any other: No comms, won't connect to networks.

docs.title: wifi_ssid
docs.text:
Type Example String wifi_ssid=GVL_Demo
  • Name of the Wi-Fi Access Point

docs.title: wifi_pass
docs.text:
Type Example String wifi_ssid=hunter2
  • Password for the Wi-Fi Access Point

docs.title: ntrip_addr
docs.text:
Type Example String ntrip_addr=example.com

  • Address of the NTRIP server

  • Can be URL or IP address

docs.title: ntrip_port
docs.text:
Type Example Integer ntrip_port=2102
  • Port of the NTRIP server

docs.title: ntrip_cred
docs.text:
Type Example String ntrip_cred=username:password
  • Username and password for the NTRIP server, separated by : symbol.

docs.title: ntrip_mountpoint
docs.text:
Type Example String ntrip_mountpoint=GVL_Nearest

  • Mount point to use with the NTRIP server

  • Used in rover mode

docs.title: send_gga
docs.text:
Type Example Integer send_gga=1

  • Whether or not to send NMEA GGA sentence to NTRIP server in rover mode

  • Required by some NTRIP servers to select a suitable basestation

docs.title: base_password
docs.text:
Type Example String base_password=123456
  • Used in Basestation mode

docs.title: base_mountpoint
docs.text:
Type Example String base_mountpoint=GVL_Base

  • Name of the NTRIP mount point to send data to

  • Used in Basestation mode

docs.title: base_x, base_y, base_z
docs.text:
base_x=415365.781
base_y=-36584.062
base_z=687452.299

  • Coordinates of the GNSS antenna

  • Used in Basestation mode

docs.title: use_mqtt
docs.text:
Type Example Integer use_mqtt=1
  • Whether or not to send real-time updates via MQTT

docs.title: mqtt_addr
docs.text:
Type Example String mqtt_addr=test.mosquitto.org

  • Address of MQTT server

  • Can be URL or IP address

docs.title: mqtt_port
docs.text:
Type Example Integer mqtt_addr=1883
  • Port of MQTT server

docs.title: mqtt_username
docs.text:
Type Example String mqtt_username=gvl_user

  • MQTT username

  • Optional

docs.title: mqtt_password
docs.text:
Type Example String mqtt_password=123456

  • MQTT password

  • Optional

docs.title: log_sd
docs.text:
Type Example Integer log_sd=0
  • Whether or not to save GNSS result to SD card

docs.title: enable_rtcm
docs.text:
Type Example Integer enable_rtcm=0

  • Whether or not to enable RTCM MSM7 output in rover mode

  • Useful for postprocessing

  • Under development

docs.title: Firmware Update
docs.text:
Note

  • Under construction, more details to come!

  • Plug the device into a computer

  • Immediately after powering on, press any key

  • Device should show up as a USB drive

  • Drag the provided firmware file into the drive

  • Safely eject the drive on PC

  • Hold power button to turn off then on again

  • Wait for update to finish

    • It will reboot itself when done
    • Should take around 10-20 seconds

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text:
Note

  • Under construction, more details to come!

docs.title: Powering On
docs.text:
• Plug cable into LEMO connector

    • Match the red dots

  • Press and hold power button for 2 seconds

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text: See the Configuration Page on how to set up your device.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text:
• Press the Power button to cycle through information display

  • Press the Play button to generate a survey point

    • Current coordinates are saved to the SD card
    • A special MQTT message is transmitted

  • Press and hold Power button to switch off
